Posted By: RunedServitor (5/7/2012 1:27:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @anytwofactors: Madness decks generally run creatures with abilities that cost "Discard a card:", such as [Wild Mongrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Mongrel), [Cephalid Inkshrouder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Inkshrouder), or in the case of a BLACK Madness deck, [Trespasser il-Vec](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trespasser il-Vec). These let you discard a card at any time, allowing you to use Madness in response to something else.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Another blast from my Magic past, the ol' Circular Logic. This card is amazing in Madness, and even hardcasted it's usually worth it if you know what you're doing. It's not useful in every deck, but it is probably the best thing that blue got out of Torment.  
  
RATING: 4.5/5
posts.html:
Another blast from my Magic past, the ol' Circular Logic. This card is amazing in Madness, and even hardcasted it's usually worth it if you know what you're doing. It's not useful in every deck, but it is probably the best thing that blue got out of Torment.

RATING: 4.5/5

posts.post_content: @drp527: lol I almost felt like pulling the Sparta joke after reading that last sentence. But yeah, that's pretty much how it works; you discard this in response to somebody casting a spell, and then you cast it targeting the spell on the stack. It's kinda hard to pull off outside of madness decks, but in a madness deck, it's a potentially more powerful version of [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak) for potentially less mana.
posts.html:
@drp527: lol I almost felt like pulling the Sparta joke after reading that last sentence. But yeah, that's pretty much how it works; you discard this in response to somebody casting a spell, and then you cast it targeting the spell on the stack. It's kinda hard to pull off outside of madness decks, but in a madness deck, it's a potentially more powerful version of Mana Leak for potentially less mana.
